content.description: The following question is based on the chord progression below.
content.question: Which of the following statements best describes chord 3 ?

choices.label: It is a root-position mediant chord that is part of a circle-of-fifths progression.
It is a submediant chord in inversion that results in a deceptive progression.
It is a leading-tone seventh chord in inversion with dominant function.
It is a root-position subdominant chord with predominant function.

content.answer: It is a root-position mediant chord that is part of a circle-of-fifths progression.

unit.text: 5: Harmony and Voice Leading II - Chord Progressions and Predominant Function

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in notated music.
